intro: Elatostema xanthophyllum, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed elatostema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a smooth texture and can vary in color depending on light exposure.
